main event: A pilot in a T-33B aircraft spotted an unidentified oval-shaped object traveling at a high rate of speed near Wright-Patterson Air Force Base in Ohio on 12 August 1965.
interesting points: The object appeared to be faster than the aircraft and emitted a thin black smoke or vapor trail as it passed by.
The object seemed to slow down as it passed under the aircraft, and its speed varied during its three descents.
The total elapsed time from the initial sighting to the object passing under the aircraft was no more than 6-8 seconds.
The document includes a hand-drawn diagram or sketch depicting the trajectory or descent of the object, but no photographic evidence.
The incident was investigated and attributed to a mirage caused by the motion of the observer and atmospheric conditions.
result: The object was attributed to a mirage, but the incident remains unexplained.
location: Near Wright-Patterson Air Force Base, Ohio
witnesses: Capt. Cannon (instructor pilot) and Capt. Wilkinson (student pilot)
photographs: No photographs, only a hand-drawn diagram or sketch
